name: TheAtlantic
text:
Voting in person during the coronavirus pandemic is about as safe as going to the grocery store, @RussellBerman reports.
https://t.co/9WIdVK4c4s

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YAppelbaum: E. Jean Carroll is writing a series of essays for @TheAtlantic, interviewing other women who have accused the president of sexual misconduct. The first installments are here:
https://t.co/NMEK0Tp6CO
https://t.co/0Q0XGqJSZ3

name: TheAtlantic
text: Our second October-issue cover story is out today. Read George Packer on how America may be on the cusp of an era of radical reform that repairs its broken democracy: https://t.co/ICZpJkl7J7

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Many presidents have had difficult relations with their generals, but we’ve never seen anything like this.” In the latest Atlantic Daily, we talk with @JeffreyGoldberg about his report that the president dismissed fallen soldiers as “losers”: https://t.co/sPZQHvegzn

name: TheAtlantic
text: Many Americans trusted intuition to help guide them through this disaster, but it has led us astray. @edyong209 details nine conceptual errors that are keeping the U.S. trapped in the pandemic: https://t.co/uAPTPQH4YE

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @SStossel: "Our collapse is so complete that the field lies open—the philosophical questions brought on by despair allow us to reimagine what kind of country we can be." https://t.co/9iJLB1yon4

name: TheAtlantic
text: What did college administrators think was going to happen? @AdamHSays writes: https://t.co/HT0xrkbsYv

name: TheAtlantic
text: "When people who oppose housing construction in the United States can block it without the president’s help, even the most NIMBY-minded of homeowners are free to base their votes on other things," @trounstine writes: https://t.co/2gZdJlWz9G

name: TheAtlantic
text: The country is at a low point—our civic bonds frayed, our politics toxic, George Packer writes. But we may be on the cusp of an era of radical reform that advances citizens’ rights, restores opportunity, and repairs our broken democracy: https://t.co/ik3XTThOqs

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: In a moment like this one, we all need to get outside from time to time. @JohnMayer's journey into the Redwoods of Northern California with @LandroverUSA reminds us why: https://t.co/ptXnpkwGeP https://t.co/rmCERSlwVx

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Before they hit the ground, the god reached out and erased the tree and erased the town and took Samuel’s hands." Read a new short story by @caleb_crain: https://t.co/ORFlvzGQ3m

name: TheAtlantic
text: “One of the odd things about being middle-aged is that now, when I redream a recurring dream, I seem to be aware that I have a history with it.” @caleb_crain talks with @AmyWeissMeyer about dreams and fiction: https://t.co/qBMY89Xc7Q

name: TheAtlantic
text: In our latest "Behind the Byline," learn more about @AdamSerwer, a staff writer on the Ideas desk, and how he approaches his work: https://t.co/EsGO5Y8RXi

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: "Woodward approaches the Trump presidency as he has approached every other subject in his long and distinguished career. But the Trump presidency is something quite unlike anything anyone in Washington has seen before.” @DavidFrum on how “Fear” fell short https://t.co/TcKOh5ZLHp

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @PeterAtlantic: Voting in person during the coronavirus pandemic is about as safe as going to the grocery store, @RussellBerman reports. https://t.co/B6MFuxVYc6
